@kmanb is using ChatGPT answers to these questions which is fine but ChatGPT is not always right so please do your own research.

comments.content: I wonder the same thing cause there are numerous questions with people saying this to kmanb, but never provide their input so I'm confused half the time!

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The project manager in this scenario should contact the Project Management Office (PMO) for guidance and approval for the new methodology.

The Project Management Office (PMO) is a centralized department or group within an organization that is responsible for establishing and maintaining project management standards, processes, and tools. The PMO often provides guidance, support, and oversight to project managers and teams, and is responsible for ensuring that projects are aligned with the organization's goals and objectives. In this case, the project manager has been hired to help transition projects from the waterfall style to an iterative approach, which marks a significant change in approach from previous projects. Therefore, it would be appropriate for the project manager to seek guidance and approval from the PMO in order to ensure that the new methodology is implemented effectively and in line with the organization's standards and practices.
